title: Child criminals twice as likely to reoffend as adults amid failure to provide jobs, training or education
text:
Child criminals are twice as likely to reoffend as adults within three months of leaving prison, according to new figures from HM inspectors.

Seventy per cent of child offenders are returning to crime within just three months of release amid a failure to tackle their drug addiction or find them adequate accommodation, training or jobs.

This compares with under 30 per cent adult offenders overall reoffending within a year and reconviction rates of 46 per cent within 12 months of release from prison.
